holidays.name: Techies’ Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the tech-savvy geeks and gadget lovers who drive innovation and embrace all things digital.
holidays.origin: Started by tech communities in the early 2000s to appreciate the impact of technology on our lives.
holidays.funFact: On October 3, many tech enthusiasts take the chance to upgrade their devices or learn a new coding language.

holidays.name: Mean Girls Day
holidays.description: A fan celebration of the cult classic movie ‘Mean Girls,’ marking the day the main character was officially invited to join the Plastics clique.
holidays.origin: Derived from a memorable line in the 2004 film where October 3 is mentioned explicitly.
holidays.funFact: October 3 is known as ‘Mean Girls Day’ because the film’s protagonist tells her crush the date when he asks what day it is.

holidays.name: Techie Appreciation Day
holidays.description: Honoring everyday tech wizards who help friends and family troubleshoot their gadgets and keep the digital world running smoothly.
holidays.origin: Informal day created by coworking spaces and IT professionals appreciation groups.
holidays.funFact: Many companies use this day to recognize their IT departments with fun awards and treats.

holidays.name: National Taco Day (Extended Celebration)
holidays.description: While National Taco Day is officially October 4, some taco aficionados happily start their celebrations a day early!
holidays.origin: National Taco Day is widely celebrated on October 4, but the enthusiasm often spills over to October 3.
holidays.funFact: Some taco restaurants offer early bird specials on October 3 to kick off the taco festivities!
